item.title: How Your Cat Is Making You Crazy - Magazine - The Atlantic
item.description: How Your Cat Is Making You Crazy: So the prolific Could tiny organisms carried by house cats be creeping into ou... http://t.co/22az1yGJ
item.content:encoded: How Your Cat Is Making You Crazy: So the prolific Could tiny organisms carried by house cats be creeping into ou... http://t.co/22az1yGJ Jaroslav Flegr is no kook. And yet, for years, he suspected his mind had been taken over by parasites that had invaded his brain. So the prolific biologist took his science-fiction hunch into the lab. What he’s now discovering will startle you. Could tiny organisms carried by house cats be creeping into our brains, causing everything from car wrecks to schizophrenia? A biologist’s science- fiction hunch is gaining credence and shaping the emerging science of mind- controlling parasites. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: theatlantic.com

item.title: The Bourne Legacy - Movie Trailers - iTunes
item.description: Teaser trailer for "The Bourne Legacy" just dropped. Not sold on Jeremy Renner's badassness yet: http://t.co/1PQen1I5
item.content:encoded: Teaser trailer for "The Bourne Legacy" just dropped. Not sold on Jeremy Renner's badassness yet: http://t.co/1PQen1I5 The narrative architect behind the Bourne film series, Tony Gilroy, takes the helm in the next chapter of the hugely popular espionage franchise that has earned almost $1 billion at the global box office: The Bourne Legacy. The writer/director expands the Bourne universe created by Robert Ludlum with an original story that introduces us to a new hero (Jeremy Renner) whose life-or-death stakes have been triggered by the events of the first three films. For The Bourne Legacy, Renner joins fellow series newcomers Rachel Weisz, Edward Norton, Stacy Keach and Oscar Isaac, while franchise veterans Albert Finney, Joan Allen, David Strathairn and Scott Glenn reprise their roles. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: apple.com

item.title: Download a Copy of The Pirate Bay, It’s Only 90 MB | TorrentFreak
item.description: Download a Copy of The Pirate Bay, It’s Only 90 MB http://t.co/oyW2aL5W #torrent
item.content:encoded: Download a Copy of The Pirate Bay, It’s Only 90 MB http://t.co/oyW2aL5W #torrent Soon The Pirate Bay will stop linking to .torrent files. Instead, the world's largest BitTorrent site will only list so-called magnet links. One of the advantages of the switch is that The Pirate Bay will be much more portable, and easier to copy. A new torrent listing all titles and magnet links on The Pirate Bay proves this point, as the public can download a copy that fits easily on a small USB stick - or even a few dozen floppies. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: torrentfreak.com

item.description: It's hard to believe that this tiny NASA invention could save millions of lives, isn't it? http://t.co/GQ8KAKun
item.content:encoded: It's hard to believe that this tiny NASA invention could save millions of lives, isn't it? http://t.co/GQ8KAKun There are no hospitals in space. The closest E.R. is back on Earth, and astronauts can't exactly jump in a cab to get there. So what happens if the sun burps out a massive blast of radiation while an astronaut is space-amblin' by? Link - Trackbacks
